meanings.definition: To have equipped or provided with something
meanings.sent1: She gitted her backpack with all the necessary supplies for the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic gitted the car with new tires and a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: He gitted his toolbox with squeaky toys to prank his friends.
meanings.sent4: The artist gitted the canvas with vibrant colors that brought the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The chef gitted the kitchen with top-of-the-line appliances to create culinary masterpieces.

meanings.definition: To have shown courage or determination
meanings.sent1: Despite his fear, he gitted himself to face the challenge head-on.
meanings.sent2: She gitted through the difficult times with a strong will and unwavering resolve.
meanings.sent3: The little boy gitted up the courage to ask his crush to the school dance.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter gitted into the burning building to save the trapped kitten.
meanings.sent5: The athlete gitted for the final sprint of the race, pushing through the pain.

meanings.definition: To have irritated or annoyed someone
meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site gitted the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: His habit of tapping his foot during meetings gitted his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The mosquito buzzing around the room gitted everyone trying to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive jingle of the ice cream truck gitted the parents in the park.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet gitted her to the point of calling a plumber.
